event_description: Apple reported stronger-than-expected fiscal Q2 2025 results, with revenue of $95.4 billion, up 5% year-over-year, and diluted EPS of $1.65, up 8% year-over-year, setting a March quarter record. Services revenue reached a new all-time high of $26.6 billion, growing 12% year-over-year. The company also announced a $100 billion share repurchase program and increased its dividend by 4% to $0.26 per share.

Apple anticipates a $900 million increase in costs for the June quarter due to newly imposed tariffs, particularly from U.S. policy targeting Chinese imports. This tariff exposure relates to a 20% IEEPA-related tariff and an additional 125% tariff for certain product categories announced in April.
